title: Commending the Stanford Grange No. 808 upon the occasion of its designation as recipient of the Distinguished Grange Award from the National Grange
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commending the Stanford Grange No. 808 upon the
occasion of its designation as recipient  of  the  Distinguished  Grange
Award from the National Grange

WHEREAS,  It is the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize that the
quality and character of life in the communities across New  York  State
are reflective of the concerned and dedicated efforts of those organiza-
tions  and individuals who would devote themselves to the welfare of the
community and its citizenry; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing  traditions,  this  Legislative Body is justly proud to commend
the Stanford Grange No. 808 upon the  occasion  of  its  designation  as
recipient of the Distinguished Grange Award from the National Grange, to
be celebrated on Sunday, January 30, 2011; and
  WHEREAS, In addition, Stanford Grange No. 808 will celebrate its 115th
Anniversary on Tuesday, January 25, 2011, and will rededicate the Grange
Hall  on Route 82 in Stanfordville with all of its building improvements
during a Grange Month Open House on Tuesday, April 26, 2011; and
  WHEREAS, Stanford Grange No. 808 was organized  in  Bangall,  Town  of
Stanford, New York, on January 23, 1896, with 18 Charter Members; and
  WHEREAS,  At the 144th Annual National Grange Convention held in Char-
lotte, North Carolina, on November 9-13, 2010, Stanford Grange No.   808
was  recognized  and  honored  as  a  "Distinguished Grange" by National
Grange President Edward  L.  Luttrell  of  Oregon  and  National  Grange
Membership/Leadership  Director Rusty Hunt of Washington State; Stanford
Grange No. 808 is the only Grange in New York State and one of 13 Grang-
es nationwide selected for this prestigious award; and
  WHEREAS, In order to be selected,  a  Community  Grange  must  fulfill
requirements established by the National Grange, some of which include a
net  gain  in membership, sending delegates to the New York State Grange
Session and another event hosted by the National Grange;  it  must  also
host  at  least two community service/educational events, send quarterly
reports to the State Grange on time, and host a legislative event; and
  WHEREAS, For almost 115 years,  the  Stanford  Grange  has  worked  to
advance  the interest of its fellow citizens in its community by provid-
ing a legislative voice and by showing them how to strengthen  the  town
through community service; and
  WHEREAS,  The  Grange  is  a  nonpartisan organization which gives its
members the opportunity to serve their neighborhoods  through  community
service  projects  that  make a difference in the lives of its citizens;
and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of  this  Legislative  Body  that  those  who
enhance  the well-being and vitality of their community and have shown a
long and sustained commitment to excellence certainly  have  earned  the
recognition and applause of all the citizens of this great Empire State;
now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
commend the Stanford Grange No. 808 upon the occasion of its designation
as recipient of the Distinguished Grange Award from the National Grange;
and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Ryan J. Orton, Secretary, Stanford Grange No. 808.
